definition: to be able to read aloud fluently/to be suitable (easy enough) for reading aloud
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to flow right off the tongue (of lyrics or poetry)/to recite with ease/catchy (of a song)

sentences.english: Just a bite may do you good, Blumberg says.
sentences.chinese: 只是咬上口可能使你更健康，布隆伯格说。

sentences.english: Let's not forget it's got some really catchy tunes.
sentences.chinese: 别忘了它的旋律也很琅琅上口啊。

sentences.english: The clutch is subject to maladjustments upon use.
sentences.chinese: 离合器在使用时易卡不上口。

sentences.english: It helps them memorize the months with a catchy rhyme.
sentences.chinese: 它以朗朗上口的韵脚来帮助他们记起月份。

sentences.english: Both shows have catchy title songs.
sentences.chinese: 两者都有琅琅上口的主题曲。

sentences.english: The children have read the poem several times, and can all recite it quite fluently now.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们把这首诗念了又念，现在都能琅琅上口了。

sentences.english: Early toilet bowls were painted cast iron and had no flange on the rim.
sentences.chinese: 早期的便池是在铸铁表面涂上油漆，且上口没有凸缘。

sentences.english: Let a unique product benefit bang-bang upper opening.
sentences.chinese: 让独特的产品利益点琅琅上口。

sentences.english: Its rude to shoveled food in and make noised in a party .
sentences.chinese: 上口地吃食物和弄出声响都是粗鲁的。

sentences.english: Words were usually repeated in his article, which make it easy to read.
sentences.chinese: 他的文章中经常出现重言，读来朗朗上口。

sentences.english: Both catchy and intriguing, they surprise and titillate the imagination.
sentences.chinese: 上口和耐人寻味的，他们惊喜，撩拨的想象力。

sentences.english: Come up with a catchy logo for it that I have to approve.
sentences.chinese: 想出了一个为它朗朗上口的标志，我已批准。
这首诗读起来琅琅上口。

sentences.english: They may also pick up foreign languages more easily than others.
sentences.chinese: 他们比其他人更容易学习外语，很快就能朗朗上口。

sentences.english: Make sure our slogan is catchy and memorable.
sentences.chinese: 记得，咱们的口号需要是既上口又好记。

sentences.english: Give your show a catchy title.
sentences.chinese: 给你的节目取个朗朗上口的名字。

definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
readily/flatly (deny, admit and so on)/a mouthful/a bite
mouth and teeth/enunciation/to articulate/diction/age (of cattle, horses etc)
to close up/to heal (of wound)/to keep one's lips sealed
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
popular piece of doggerel/common phrase repeated as a jingle
eloquence that generates perfume (idiom); profound and significant text
